suncertify.db

Class LockingManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.LockingManager

  • public class LockingManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to lock record in the DBCache to prevent multiple clients modifying the same record at the same time.
    Author:
    Robbie

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LockingManager() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isLocked(long recNo)
      Checks if the record passed in is locked or unlocked.
      java.lang.Long lock(long recNo)
      Allows the record passed in to be locked by a client so cannot be modified by another client.
      void unlock(long recNo, java.lang.Long cookie)
      Allows locked records to be unlocked.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LockingManager

        public LockingManager()

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public java.lang.Long lock(long recNo)
                    throws RecordNotFoundException
        Allows the record passed in to be locked by a client so cannot be modified by another client.
        Parameters:
        recNo - record to lock.
        Returns:
        Cookie to allow the client that locked the record to unlock it at a future time.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - thrown if no record matching the recNo in DBCache.

      • unlock

        public void unlock(long recNo,
          java.lang.Long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
        Allows locked records to be unlocked.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The record to unlock
        cookie - The cookie for the locked record. Prevents clients the didn't lock the record from unlocking it.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Thrown if incorrect cookie used to unlock.

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked(long recNo)
        Checks if the record passed in is locked or unlocked.
        Parameters:
        recNo - Record to check.
        Returns:
        true if the record is locked, false otherwise.
